Since there are no partial days in the problem statement, we can assume that Ryan doesn't study English on all of those days. Instead, we need to figure out how many full days of English study there are. By dividing the total hours spent on English by the daily hours, and rounding down to the nearest whole number (as Ryan cannot spend a fraction of a day on English), we get 344 hours / 24 hours/day ≈ 14.33 days ≈ 15 days.
